summary: This is an FBI Electronic Communication summarizing an interview conducted on December 4, 2018, with an individual regarding the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sexual exploitation of minors in West Palm Beach, Florida. The interviewee describes his role as a driver who transported females to Epstein's residence for massages, his interactions with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and the recruitment and payment structure.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the federal investigation for sexual exploitation of minors. The interviewee describes working for him, transporting females to his residence, and details about their relationship and arguments.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as someone who would call the interviewee to ask him to bring specific girls to Epstein's residence. The interviewee initially believed she was Epstein's wife.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as contacting the driver to arrange for specific girls to be brought to Epstein's residence, indicating a collaborative role in the alleged operation.
The interviewee worked for Epstein as a driver, transporting females to Epstein's residence for massages and was paid $200 per trip. They had a personal history dating back to school.

events.title: Interview regarding Epstein investigation
events.description: The FBI interviewed an individual in West Palm Beach, Florida, regarding the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sexual exploitation of minors.

events.title: FBI Electronic Communication drafted
events.description: An FBI Electronic Communication was drafted summarizing the details from the 2007 interview with a driver for Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Epstein's residence (West Palm Beach, specific address redacted)
keyFacts: An interviewee described working as a driver for Jeffrey Epstein, transporting females to Epstein's West Palm Beach residence for massages, for which he was paid $200 per trip.
Ghislaine Maxwell was involved in the operation, calling the driver to request specific girls be brought to Epstein's residence.
The driver recruited at least one female (name redacted) to work for Epstein, and Epstein paid for her to attend a massage school, but she did not return.
The driver stated he ensured the females he brought were over eighteen, but his role was limited to driving; he never went upstairs in Epstein's residence.
Epstein gave the driver $500 in cash to help pay off car tickets, indicating a financial relationship beyond payment for driving services.
